newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Manila wants to raise government workers' wage.
newsitem.headline: Manila wants to raise government workers' wage.

text.p: Philippine President Fidel Ramos said on Tuesday that he is finalising a bill to raise salaries for government workers from 1998.
He told government workers in Puerto Princesa, capital of the southwestern island province of Palawan, that the bill would be sent to the legislature as soon as it was finalised.
The bill is expected to benefit about 1.2 million government workers.
Government workers have received wage increases since 1992 under the Salary Standardisation Law II (SSL II). The fourth and final tranche is to be implemented next year.

"By 1998, we are expecting that there will be another round of salary increases and possible additional benefits for our government workers under the new SSL III," Ramos said, according to a statement from the presidential palace.
By next year, the average basic salary of government employees will be 94,254 pesos annually, up from 38,557 in 1992.
Private sector employees have also been demanding pay rises following a series of fuel price increases as the energy sector moves towards full liberalisation.
